goal.tools.logging

Class GOALLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.logging.GOALLogger
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GOALLoggerDelayed

    public class GOALLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    The GOAL logging tool.

    The standard Logger requires quite a long chain of components requiring piping of the messages through various layers before the user can reading it. This is nice as long as all works but fatal if a part of the chain hangs, or if these layers are not in place to start with (when running a stand-alone GOAL without IDE). See also trac 1163 and 1191.

    Therefore we use the private field #showLogsInIDE to turn this all off at right at this point. When that property is true, all logging info is piped through a set of Loggers. If that property is false, the log info is printed directly to System.out.

    We can't call the constructor of Logger therefore we need to wrap the logger as a field of our logger class, deviating from the Java version in this respect.

    Logging to file is also handled here. The default FileHandler settings are used. Files are written to the user's home directory. If you turn off the logging-rerouting, log to file is also disabled.

    Tech note: we don't really care about having unique GOALLoggers for a given name, as all is in the end routed through the unique logging.Logger anyway, and if the output is printed directly instead it also does not matter to have a unique logger.

    Author:
    W.Pasman aug2010

        Creates a logger.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the logger. Should be indicative of its main function.
        eligibleForLogToFile - TODO: make this fully dependent on user's choices. must be set to true if this logger can write the logs also to file. Whether logs are written to file also depends on the user's preferences.
